html: Jehovah’s glory rests on his people at the time he comes to reign among them (Isaiah 4:5; 24:23; 60:1-2). His people, too, however, ascend to glory: “From a sector of the earth we hear singing: ‘Glorious are the righteous!” (Isaiah 24:16); “In that day the plant of Jehovah shall be beautiful and glorious, and the earth’s fruit the pride and glory of the survivors of Israel” (Isaiah 4:2). The servant’s establishing righteousness among Jehovah’s people leads to their attaining higher spiritual levels, as signified by the new name he gives them (Isaiah 56:5; 65:15; 66:22) with its accompanying new commission.
